dna.gloss: (biochemistry) a long linear polymer found in the nucleus of a cell and formed from nucleotides and shaped like a double helix

dna chip.gloss: a microchip that holds DNA probes that form half of the DNA double helix and can recognize DNA from samples being tested

dna fingerprint.gloss: biometric identification obtained by examining a person's unique sequence of DNA base pairs

dnieper.gloss: a river that rises in Russia near Smolensk and flowing south through Belarus and Ukraine to empty into the Black Sea

dnieper river.gloss: a river that rises in Russia near Smolensk and flowing south through Belarus and Ukraine to empty into the Black Sea

dnipropetrovsk.gloss: city in east central Ukraine on the Dnieper River
